comments.body: Maybe we should download those and add to the recipe to ensure they won't change or disappear ?

Alternatively since this seems to be necessary for other Xorg packages. Maybe it is worthwhile to package these bits in some other package (e.g. `xorg-build-helpers` or something). That way they can be tracked in one package, but used elsewhere.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2,6 @@:: config.guess files too ancient to recognize 64-bit Windows!
curl -sSL -o config.guess "http://git.savannah.gnu.org/gitweb/?p=config.git;a=blob_plain;f=config.guess"
curl -sSL -o config.sub "http://git.savannah.gnu.org/gitweb/?p=config.git;a=blob_plain;f=config.sub"
if errorlevel 1 exit 1
bash %RECIPE_DIR%\build.sh
